reference.title: verbs
reference.shortdesc: verbs implement a variety of cryptographic processes and data-security techniques. Each available verb is documented in detail in a separate topic.

section.p: For each documented verb, a Java Native Interface (JNI) is defined that you can use for JNI work.
section.note: In this JNI, a new data type is replacing the old type since version 5.2. Both types inherit from an abstract class . Thus, type is still supported, so you can run existing applications with this deprecated data type. However, start using type for new applications instead, because may be removed in the future.

ul.li: describes how to use the resource control verbs.

describes the verbs for generating and maintaining AES, DES, and HMAC cryptographic keys, the verb (which generates 8-byte random numbers), the verb (which generates up to 8192 bytes of random content), and the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) security protocol. This chapter also describes utilities to build DES and AES tokens, generate and translate control vectors, and describes the PKA verbs that support DES and AES key distribution.
describes the verbs for enciphering and deciphering data.
describes the verbs for generating and verifying Message Authentication Codes (MACs), generating Modification Detection Codes (MDCs) and generating hashes (SHA-1, MD5, RIPEMD-160).
describes the use of key storage, key tokens, and associated verbs.

describes the verbs for use in support of finance-industry applications. This includes several categories.

Verbs that generate and verify VISA card verification values and card security codes.
Verbs to support smart card applications using the EMV (Europay MasterCard Visa) standards.
